lesson.title_and_level: Intermediate - Sheep, Wolves, and Fruit: a Riddle

sentence.idiomatic: While she was watching a movie yesterday, then suddenly she started screaming.
When she heard the bad news, she screamed and then fainted.
A fire broke out and the passengers in the vehicle all started screaming.
I don't agree with that kind of a pessimistic attitude towards life.
Which style of film is most popular nowadays?
This animal likes to go out to look for food at night.
Take a guess as to what this character means.
She has guessed incorrectly. That man wearing the hat isn't the boss.
This riddle is so difficult that I definitely can't guess it.
There is a crowd of people standing in front of the office building.

word.literal: to fly in the direction of

sentence.idiomatic: Is that huge flock of swallows flying towards the south?
There is a group of ducklings following after the mother duck.
Did he grow up in the grasslands?
There are a lot of horses in the field.
A flock of sheep came to a field. Guess the fruit. (strawberry)
Then a pack of wolves came to the field. Guess the fruit. (red bayberry)
A pack of wolves came to the field, but they didn’t eat the sheep. Guess the marine animal. (shrimp)
The wolves came to the field, the sheep bleated in fear, the wolves still didn’t eat the sheep. Guess the marine animal. (lobster)
